required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Infrared Thermography for the Diagnosis of Musculoskeletal Pain
clinical_study.official_title: The Contribution and Validity of Infrared Thermography in the Diagnosis of Musculoskeletal Pain

brief_summary.textblock: This study sought to evaluate the vasomotor response in the pain referral area of healthy individuals, performing the same procedure with and without the experience of delayed onset muscle soreness.

detailed_description.textblock: Validity of infrared thermography for properly diagnosing musculoskeletal pain and their clinical applicability is lacking. This study investigates temperature changes on the upper extremity before and after a suprathreshold stimulation (painful stimulus) with a digital algometer over the infraspinatus muscle. The same procedure is performed in two consecutive days, 24 hours apart (Day-1 and Day-2). At the end of Day-1, an eccentric exercise is performed in order to to induce delayed onset muscle soreness on the external rotators of the shoulder.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in temperature of pixels on the upper extremity: infrared thermography
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day-1 (baseline assessment, pre exercise before painful stimulus), Day-1 (baseline assessment, pre exercise after painful stimulus), Day-2 (24 hours post-exercise before painful stimulus), Day-2 (24 hours post-exercise after painful stimulus)
primary_outcome.description: A thermography image of the upper extremity of the body will be taken on both days of assessment before and after applying a painful stimulus. Changes in colour pixels will be analysed to determine temperature changes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Pressure Pain Thresholds: pressure algometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day-1 (baseline assessment, pre exercise before painful stimulus), Day-2 (24 hours post-exercise before painful stimulus)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in pressure pain thresholds will be determined with pressure algometry over the infraspinatus muscle. Pressure Pain Threshold is defined as the exact time point where the pressure is first being perceived as painful.

arm_group.description: Participants free from any pain specific to the upper limb, chronic pain or other disease.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with no acute pain, chronic pain or other medical disorders relevant to this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being healthy and free from any pain specific to the upper limbs and/or in general.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of chronic pain.
- Any systemic diseases or regional pathology which can interfere with the outcome measures.

patient_data.ipd_description: There are currently no plan on sharing data from this study with other researchers.
